You do not need a web server.

Installing Heritrix on a server is exactly t=
he same as on your Ubuntu desktop. By default Heritrix will only allow loca=
lhost to access the web GUI. To enable access from other IP addresses you n=
eed to specify the -b option when you launch Heritrix.

You could specify i=
t as -b / to enable access from any host or specify a comma separated list =
of IP addresses or hostnames.

E.g.: $HERITRIX_HOME/bin/heritrix -a admin:a=
dmin -b /
or: $HERITRIX_HOME/bin/heritrix -a admin:admin -b 192.168.0.1 (re=
place the IP address with your own)

You should then be able to access the =
web user interface on https://YOUR-SERVER:8443/ where YOUR-SERVER is either=
 its hostname or IP address from any machine listed in the bind directive.
